1604066851_mirrored_geekless_github.body: guys, IMO files in a zite should not only compatible with web usage, personally I wish they were more like network filesystems. Unicode support is pretty good nowadays. I completely disagree denying any char in zeronet filenames. When you are about to access them via http interface, you `urlEncode` them. Always. If the underlaying filesystem happens to not to cope with certain filenames, then it's a typical case of "you can not host this site as-is". So speaking of access via http, urlEncoding can encode all filenames which supported by any filesystem, even more, because `%00`. So please do unicode.
